title: Why Electricity Blackouts Are Coming to Michigan
sub_head: The shutdown of a nuclear power plant makes the state vulnerable to cloudy, windless days.
body:
Midland, Mich.
Whatever hopes people might have had for saving Michigan’s Palisades Nuclear Generating Station, it’s too late. On May 20, the plant shut down, taking with it 6.5% of the state’s electricity and 15% of the state’s clean energy. This leaves Michiganders with less reliable electricity and higher prices.
